segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot is already in the water, but she doesn’t even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is shaking under him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting so patiently, like she’s used to this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the cookie jar, and I can almost taste the cookies from here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is in her own little world, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, like nothing bad could ever happen there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will share the cookies or if the boy will hog them all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is going to tip, and I can’t do anything to stop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to ruin the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
